awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  A Cryo-EM Automation and Intelligence Platform for Drug Discovery
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase  II project is to improve disease research and drug discovery. Cryogenic Electron Microscopy (cryo-EM) is one of the most impactful and vital tools of biological structure analysis today.  The proposed project improves the current methods to achieve better accuracy and productivity, with faster user training.

The proposed project improves imaging by cryo-EM. The images currently generated by cryo-EM are highly noisy and thus requires extensive processing to build recognizable structures (proteins and others). Single-particle cryo-EM is a method that produces images of individual particles and can potentially analyze biological structures at the single-molecule level.  This project uses Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) techniques to mitigate the issues.  AI/ML algorithms can automate the workflow, facilitating quality data and the development of 3D models.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
CryoEM is the method used to image frozen biological molecules without the use of structure-altering dyes or fixatives or the need for crystallization to provide a more accurate picture of the molecules and a greater understanding of biological function.  In 2017, the Chemistry Nobel Prize was awarded to 3 scientists "for developing cryo-electron microscopy for the high-resolution structure determination of biomolecules in solution”.

One of the key unmet needs is that data collection and procession is extremely time-consuming. This is a significant problemfor this emerging technology as the equipment is very expensive, availability is limited, and the experts are few, with theiravailability also very limited.

HTI designed and developed CryoFAST, which automates data collection, using Machine Learning Techniques.

CryoFAST is a powerful tool designed to automate the process of Cryo-EM sample screening and data collection. By leveraging advanced microscope controls and object detection models, CryoFAST significantly enhances the efficiency and accuracy of Cryo-EM imaging.

CryoFAST’s multi-grid functionality enables the software to automatically acquire data seamlessly with grid swapping, screening up to twelve grids without manual intervention and deliver multi-shot high magnification images.  It increases data throughput by 4X vs traditional solutions. The easy-to-use GUI creates opportunity for rapid deployment into labs while delivering key tools for data management.

The attached graphics provide measured metrics.  They were presented at several conferences, including at M&M 2023, M&M 2024.

CryoFAST has already gone thru several releases, with these features:

Release

Content/Support

Release 1.0 in Q1, 2024

●  Deployed in Docker

●  Faster RCNN models for square and hole detection

●  SerialEM support

●  Thermo-Fisher Scientific microscopes

●  Gatan K3 camera

●  Automated Sample Screening and Data collection

●  Automatic grid swapping to run multi-grid workflows

Release 1.1 in Q2, 2024

Release 1.0 Features plus

●  Beam centering

●  Allows multiple shots per hole, or an off-center shot within a hole

●  Improvements to multi-grid capabilities

●  Filter to remove squares near the grid edge

Release 1.2 in Q3, 2024

Release 1.1 Features plus

●  Aperture controls

●  Major improvements to JEOL CryoARM compatibility

●  Auto generated screening reports

Release 1.3 in Q4, 2024

Release 1.2 Features plus

●  Data Visualization in CryoFAST GUI


HTI also developed CryoFAST for Gatan's Latitude product, and the release is targeted for Q1, 2024.


Last Modified: 12/30/2024
Modified by: Narasimha Kumar
